title: Define Project Scope and Requirements
description: Gather and document the requirements for the KnowledgeGraphDocumenter system, including the types of documentation to be processed (e.g., text files, PDFs, web pages, API docs), the desired output format for the knowledge graph (e.g., RDF, OWL, JSON-LD, GraphQL), any specific constraints or preferences (e.g., support for specific file formats, performance requirements, security considerations, accessibility standards, multi-language support), and the expected use cases or applications of the knowledge graph in different departments within the organization (e.g., engineering, product management, customer service, sales).

title: Design System Architecture - Revised
description: Revise the description to better reflect the scope of work. Design the overall architecture of the KnowledgeGraphDocumenter system, including the components and their interactions, data flow, integration with existing systems, data storage (using NoSQL databases for scalability), scalability considerations, address potential security concerns (implementing encryption and authentication mechanisms), and perform a threat model to identify any additional security requirements. Additionally, consider the use of microservices architecture for better maintainability and extendability.

title: Develop Documentation Parsing Module
description: Implement a module to parse and extract relevant information from various types of documentation formats (e.g., Markdown, HTML, PDF, Word documents).

title: Develop Knowledge Graph Creation Module
description: Implement a module to create and maintain the knowledge graph based on the extracted information from the documentation.

title: Design Knowledge Graph Data Model - Updated
description: Define the data model and schema for the knowledge graph, including entities (documents, topics, people, organizations), relationships (author, mentions, belongs to), properties, and data types. Ensure the data model supports efficient querying and retrieval of information, with a focus on maintainability, modularity, scalability, and performance optimizations. Consider edge cases, error handling, and potential future expansions. Propose methods for version control and data backups to ensure data integrity, including strategies for handling large datasets. Define naming conventions and guidelines for entity and relationship types. Include considerations for indexing strategies, normalization, and denormalization techniques to optimize queries and reduce complexity. Provide examples of query patterns and potential use cases to demonstrate the practicality of the proposed data model. If applicable, suggest any necessary integrations with existing systems or APIs, and outline the benefits and challenges associated with each integration. To ensure thoroughness, also consider data privacy and security implications, and propose strategies for handling sensitive information. For the review phase, provide a clear roadmap for testing and validation, including test cases, and a plan for gathering feedback from stakeholders. Lastly, suggest any necessary documentation updates to reflect changes in the data model design. If applicable, propose a timeline for task completion. If ready for the next state, update the 'rfc_state' field accordingly.

title: Implement Knowledge Graph Storage and Querying
description: Develop the components for storing and querying the knowledge graph, potentially using a graph database or other suitable storage solution.

title: Develop User Interface
description: Design and implement a user interface for interacting with the knowledge graph, including visualizations, search, and exploration capabilities.

title: Implement Documentation Update Monitoring
description: Develop a mechanism to monitor for updates to the organization's documentation and trigger the knowledge graph update process.

title: Set up Continuous Integration and Deployment
description: Configure a CI/CD pipeline for automated building, testing, and deployment of the KnowledgeGraphDocumenter system.

title: Conduct Security Audit
description: Perform a security audit of the KnowledgeGraphDocumenter system to identify and mitigate potential vulnerabilities.
